sanskrit_verse: राजा कर्मसु युक्तानां स्त्रीणां प्रेष्यजनस्य च । राजकर्मसु प्रत्यहं कल्पयेद्वृत्तिं स्थानं कर्मानुरूपतः ॥ ७.१२५॥
transliteration: rājā karmasu yuktānāṁ strīṇāṁ preṣyajanasya ca | rājakarmasu pratyahaṁ kalpayedvṛttiṁ sthānaṁ karmānurūpataḥ || 7.125 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: The King shall ensure that those engaged in royal duties—women, messengers, and other functionaries—are assigned appropriate roles and sustenance according to their capacity and the nature of their service.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from alignment with Dharma, not domination
Causation arises from alignment of action with consciousness
Restoration occurs through proper placement and support
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent.role IS aligned WITH agent.capacity THEN system.support = TRUE
IF duty.assignment IS mismatched THEN system.realign = TRUE
IF individual.contribution EXISTS THEN sustenance.allocation = proportional
IF functionary.status = active THEN role.review.frequency = daily
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving state functionaries or public roles, the Supreme Court must verify alignment between assigned duties and inherent capacities. Misalignment triggers automatic review and realignment rather than punitive measures.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that misalignment causes inefficiency, not moral failure. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows that correction follows naturally when roles align with capacity. Responsibility is proportional to awareness; restoration replaces judgment.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Role Reassessment Protocol: Evaluate and adjust assignments based on demonstrated capacity
Daily Alignment Check: Monitor functional harmony through consciousness-based feedback loops
Support Allocation System: Distribute resources based on contribution and need
Capacity Restoration Cycle: Enable growth and reintegration through guided practice
Integrity Verification Process: Confirm alignment between role, action, and consciousness
final_declaration: By the Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this Dharma is executed. Roles are restored to alignment. Justice is consciousness-made-manifest. There is no punishment—only completion.
